parameter.name: archive
parameter.description:
The URL to the waveform archive where all data is stored.
Format: [service://]location[#type]
"service": The type of the archive. If not given, "sds://" is implied assuming an SDS archive. The SDS archive structure is defined as YEAR/NET/STA/CHA/NET.STA.LOC.CHA.YEAR.DAYFYEAR, e.g. 2018/GE/APE/BHZ.D/GE.APE..BHZ.D.2018.125
Other archive types may be considered by plugins.

parameter.name: threads
parameter.description: Number of threads scanning the archive in parallel.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.description: Acceptable derivation of end time and start time of successive records in multiples of sample time.

parameter.name: maxSegments
parameter.description: Maximum number of segments per stream. If the limit is reached no more segments are added to the database and the corresponding extent is flagged as to fragmented. Use a negative value to disable any limit.

group.name: filter
group.description:
Parameters of this section limit the data processing to either
reduce the scan time of larger archives or to
prevent deletion of availability information even though parts of the archive have been deleted or moved to a different location.

group.name: time
group.description: Limit the processing by record time.

parameter.name: start
parameter.description: Start of data availability check given as date string or as number of days before now.

parameter.name: end
parameter.description: End of data availability check given as date string or as number of days before now.

group.name: wfid
group.description: Limit the processing by waveform stream ids.

parameter.name: include
parameter.description: Comma-separated list of waveform ids to process. If empty all WFIDs are accepted unless an exclude filter is defined. The following wildcards are supported: '*' and '?'.

parameter.name: exclude
parameter.description: Comma-separated list of waveform ids to exclude from processing. Excludes take precedence over includes. The following wildcards are supported: '*' and '?'.

group.name: mtime
group.description: Parameters of this section control the rescan of data chunks. By default the last update time of the extent is compared with the record file modification time to read only files modified since the list run.

parameter.name: ignore
parameter.description: If set to true all data chunks are read independent of their mtime.

parameter.name: start
parameter.description: Only read chunks modified after specific date given as date string or as number of days before now.

parameter.name: end
parameter.description: Only read chunks modified before specific date given as date string or as number of days before now.

option.description: Do not scan the archive but generate test data for each stream in the inventory. Format: days,gaps,gapslen,overlaps,overlaplen. E.g., the following parameter list would generate test data for 100 days (starting from now()-100) which includes 150 gaps with a length of 2.5s followed by 50 overlaps with an overlap of 5s: --generate-test-data=100,150,2.5,50,5
